intro: Eupatoriastrum pubiflorum, commonly known as the hairy-flowered eupatoriastrum, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features showy, yellow flowers that are typically arranged in a cluster, with hairy stems and leaves. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
